alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued December 27 at 3:27AM MST until December 29 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT BEGINNING WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet and East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet. * WHEN...Wednesday morning through early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Falling snow could produce blowing snow and reduced visibilities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is high confidence for very strong west winds in the Sacramento Mountains Wednesday. The strongest winds will most likely be during Wednesday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet
